fields.description:
Summary

If you try to build a table via the new issue detail view, the final result will be in plain text:

!Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 2.57.26 PM.png!

But if you go to the issue view and comment the very same table, it will work:
  !Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 3.01.06 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 3.01.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It will even display correctly in the detail view:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 3.02.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 


It is the same behaviour with the description field.

Environment
 Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce
 * In a board view, click on a card (issue):
  ** Build a table in the comment field:
     ||Test||Task||
     |(/)|Test able rendering|

  ** Click on *Save* and check that the result is in plain text.
 * Now in the view screen of the very same issue, comment the same table. You will see that it will render correctly;
 * Get back to the issue's detail view, the last commented table will be correctly rendered as well.

Expected Results
 The table should render when you add a comment via the detail view as well.

Actual Results
 When commenting via the detail view, the result is plain text.

Workaround
 Add the table via the issue view screen.
fields.summary: Tables won't be rendered in the comments nor in the description if edited through the new issue detail view

fields.description:
Problem
In Jira, the notification e-mail doesn't send an auto-reply stating that it is only used for outgoing mail

Suggestion
Either our service desk should send out emails as support@instancename.atlassian.net, or jira@instancename.atlassian.net should auto-reply. We can't have e-mails going into a black hole and have people not know the email isn't being processed.
fields.summary: The notification e-mail should send an auto-reply stating that it is only used for outgoing mail

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition

When managing filter in Jira, there is no option to organize them in a custom sort method. It is only sorted by alphabetical order.
h4. Suggested Solution

Allow users to custom sort these by bringing the up/down, or drag and drop buttons.

Enhance the user and admin experience. There are users that work with many filters, so it would be easier to manage them.

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues with Story Issue Types missing from Sprints on a scrum board and they are being added to backlog. The users are not able to move Stories back to Sprint from Backlog section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Scrum board which has Story issue types included in it.
# Check the backlog of the board and find a Story.
# Try to move Story from backlog to an active sprint. No error is displayed in the UI.
# When page is refreshed, Story goes back into Backlog.

h3. Expected Results
* Stories should be displayed in the correct Sprint.

h3. Actual Results
* Stories are missing from the sprints even though they assigned to a Sprint.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Issues with Story Issue Types missing from Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever a CSV import is being done with the "time spent" and "total time spent" field provided, the worklog (total time spent) value adds  "time spent" and "total time spent" which shouldn't be. 


h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Do a CSV import with the "time spent" and "total time spent" field provided in the CSV.
 # After the import is complete, the worklog accumulates

h3. Expected Result
Only the total time spent should represent the worklog.

h3. Actual results
The "time spent" and "total time spent" gets added causing an incorrect work logged value..

h3. Workaround
Remove the "time spent" value or column from the CSV file.
fields.summary: Time spent and and Total time spent field adds up during CSV import

fields.description: This is quite a frustrating and annoying issue. The trigger for Jira ticket mentions is not intuitive. Almost no-one in my team types issues with full capital letters and a hyphen. So the Jira bot only recognizes `PRJ-123` and not `prj-123` or `prj123` or `prj 123`. Perhaps the last two cases are not feasible as that pattern is pretty generic, but at least it should interpret and parse lowercase keys as well.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Epic Link filter don't work on Jira basic search when the Project Key is a SQL reserved word.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project where the Project Key will be created as a SQL reserver word such as *Soy Teu Rico Indoor No Grid* (pkey= STRING) or *Saw Elephant Lion Endorsing Certain Telegrapher* (pkey= SELECT).
 # Create a Epic for that project.
 # Create a Story and add that Epic to the Story Epic Link field.
 # Navigate to the Jira Search page: Jira Home > Issues > Search issues.
 # Select the project where the pkey is a reserved word then select More > Epic Link.
 # No result is shown for that field and if you type the Epic name the outcome is 'No Matches'.

Check [this GIF|http://recordit.co/E7jTwFuneS] for a more visual content.

(!) If you select no project, the Epic Link field will work.
h3. Expected Results

The Epics within that project should be selectable at the Epic Link search field.
h3. Actual Results

No epic is found.
 !image.png|thumbnail!
h3. Solution / Workaround

Change the project key as per [editing a project's details|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-a-project-s-details-938021482.html]
 or use the [advanced search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html]. Example JQL:
{code:java}
project = "SELECT" and 'Epic Link' = aqqq{code}
fields.summary: Epic Link filter doesn't work on Jira basic search when the Project Key is a SQL reserved word.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues with Story Issue Types missing from boards, and removed from all Issue Type Scheme. This happened after creating a "Simplified" Project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a simplified project
# Go back to your board

h3. Expected Results
* Issues with Story issue types still remains on the board
* Story issue type is still associated on the project's Issue Type Scheme

h3. Actual Results
* Issues with Story issue types are missing from the board
* Story issue type is no longer associated on the project's Issue Type Scheme

h3. Notes
* The root cause of this issue has been fixed for now, however we are still working on the fix for Story issue type that has been disassociated from the Issue Type Scheme
* By default, Story issue type should be associated to all "Software" type project
* Therefore, we will associate Story issue type to Issue Type Schemes of "Software" type projects

h3.Workaround
The manual workaround at the moment would be:
# Proceed to your project's settings
# Click the "Issue types" menu on the sidebar
# Click on the "Actions" button > "Edit issue types"
# Drag the "Story" from "Available Issue Types" to "Issue Types for Current Scheme"
# Click on the save button

Or alternatively, you can also 
# Proceed to the Issue Type Schemes page in Jira Administration:
#* https://<your_site>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ManageIssueTypeSchemes!default.jspa
# Look for your project, and click "edit"
# Drag the "Story" from "Available Issue Types" to "Issue Types for Current Scheme"
# Click on the save button
fields.summary: Issues with Story Issue Types missing from boards, and removed from all Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user access Atlassian Home > People section they might see other users that they should not have access to, despite the Browse users global permission in the Jira instance.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud 
* Atlassian Home

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# in your instance, set the Browse users global permission to only admins, or remove this permission
# create a test user with no access to projects
# using the incognito mode, log in as this newly created user
# access the Atlassian Home by clicking the hamburger (app switch) menu - link https://instance.atlassian.net/home/people

h3. Expected Results
* The user should not see other users 

h3. Actual Results
* In case the Atlassian account of the user is a generic domain (such as @google.com, @outlook.com, etc)
** the user will see every other user in the instance
* In case the Atlassian account of the user is from a company domain (@company.com)
** the user will see other users that have the same domain

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Atlassian Home People Directory show user information restricted by Jira Browse Users Global Permission

h3. Summary

When having multiple tabs open on your web browser, when creating an Issue on your Board, the Issue creator chooses the Projects from the other tabs as its default Project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have 2 tabs open on your web browser with 2 separate Boards (Tab A with Board A and Tab B with Board B)
# Create an Issue on Tab A for Board A, then navigate to Tab B and create another Issue for Board B.

h3. Expected Results

The Issue created on Tab A is created in Project A and the Issue created in Tab B is created in Project B

h3. Actual Results

Both Issues are created for Project A

h3. Notes

This was tested on Chrome

h3.Workaround

Keep a close watch on the default Project being populated when creating Issues with multiple tabs on your browser.

!Project - Use a different scheme.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Right now, the issue creation through HTML links mentioned in [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/creating-issues-via-direct-html-links-159474.html] is meant to be used on Jira Server, and also the article says this feature is not a supported component in Jira applications:
{quote}
The JIRA functionality described on this page is not maintained as a supported component of JIRA applications. Consequently Atlassian cannot guarantee to provide any assistance in configuring or implementing it.

We recommend using the JIRA REST API instead of following the steps on this page, as the content is now quite outdated. Please see our JIRA REST API Tutorials for further information.
{quote}

This feature is not mentioned in Cloud, but it works, if the correct parameters are set: https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa?pid=<project id>
However, some unexpected behavior may be noticed, since it's not formally supported.

h3. Suggested Solution
Support this feature to create issues through an HTML link, and provide to the user a way to generate a link to this create issue modal with preset values, as it is stated in the previously mentioned article.

If the customer has a public project, the users still need to browse on the instance and navigate to the desired project to create issues.

h3. Why this is important
Some customers don't have knowledge on REST API, as it mentioned as a workaround in the article, therefore supporting this feature would be useful for the customer that wants to provide a direct link to create issues to internal or external users.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use REST API to create issues.
fields.summary: Provide support to issue creation using HTML links

{panel:title=Status Update 18/11/2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
The same explanation as for https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21372 

I am sorry that I've mislead many of you with a previous comment on how fast we will be able to address this issue. 

Unfortunately I've failed to properly estimate when we could have started investigating this issue due to other more urgent problems. Thus I am moving this issue back to 'Gathering impact' state till we will be able to properly prioritise the 'exact text' issue. 

There is no clear estimate of when we can start working on this issue. 
{panel}
h3. Summary
 - JQL advanced searching using operators reference *CONTAINS* with "Exact Phrase" does not return expected result. Eg : using “\”new test\”” but it also returns issue that has “next new csv line Test”

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with summary of "new test" then create another issue with summary of "next new csv line Test"
 # Go to search issue and execute this JQL search
 ** summary ~ “\”new test\””

h3. Expected Results
 - Only issue with summary of "new test"

h3. Actual Results
 - returns issues that has “next new csv line Test”
 - !image-2018-04-11-02-39-17-996.png|width=489,height=212!

h3. Workaround

Workaround is being mentioned at this community post here: [Solved: How to query Summary for EXACT match?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Core-questions/How-to-query-Summary-for-EXACT-match/qaq-p/588482]. To elaborate, using this paid add-on: [ScriptRunner for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6820/scriptrunner-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] would do the trick for now:

*ScriptRunner Enhanced Search*
{code:java}
issueFunction in issueFieldMatch("project = CSCRUM", "summary", "new test")
{code}
!image-2020-02-12-14-48-32-028.png|thumbnail!

*Jira Issue Navigator*
!image-2020-02-12-15-26-37-526.png|thumbnail!

Search for Multiple Strings in Scriptrunner using regex
{code:java}
issueFunction in issueFieldMatch("project = CSCRUM", "summary", "new.*|test.*")
{code}
!image-2020-02-12-14-56-28-012.png|thumbnail!

Feel free to refer to this add-on documentation here for more information: [ScriptRunner Enhanced Search|https://scriptrunner-docs.connect.adaptavist.com/jiracloud/enhanced-search.html#_issuefieldexactmatch]
fields.summary: JQL Contains "Exact Phrase" does not return the result as expected

It would be nice if this level could be raised, or another workaround provided.
fields.summary: Jira REST API Throttling.

fields.description:
It would be useful to have the system email sent to only a certain subset of Portal Only Users.

Use case:
 * We have a software release coming up
 * Only certain Customer users / emails require notification
 * Customers do not log in regularly to the Portal / shared email used for distribution on Customer side
 * Using the system email, send to only these Customer users with personalised notification of software release, which can then be distributed on Customer side

Current case:
 * System email sends to all Users in a project role e.g. Service Desk Customers only
 * Cannot use groups for Portal Only users (Customers) therefore cannot define a subset
 * Can place an announcement banner on the Customer Portal however this is not seen unless Customer User logs in
fields.summary: System Email to only certain Customers / Portal Only Users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi everyone,

There are at least two related but distinct themes on this issue, so it's important that we address both of them to avoid any misunderstanding. The first is regarding tables and emoji in the new issue view. Due to technical constraints, some of you currently won't be able to create tables and emoji in the new issue view. This effects anyone who doesn't yet have the new issue view for full-page issues. We expect to remedy this over the next few months so that anyone using the new view will be able to create tables and emoji. The method for creating these, though, will be via markdown. For those of you in this category, if you need to create tables or use emoji in the meantime, you can click through to the old issue view or turn off the new issue view for now by going to your avatar > Personal settings.

For anyone who already has the new issue view for full-page issues though, you can add tables and emoji to your content by clicking the table button in the UI, using the Shift + Option + T shortcut, or by pressing / (this is a handy shortcut to know) and starting to type "table". You can read more about markdown formatting in Jira Cloud in our [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/markdown-and-keyboard-shortcuts/].

The second theme is wiki markup generally. To be transparent, we are closing this issue as we have no plans to support wiki markup in the new editor and new issue view. We're supporting markdown across Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket Cloud to provide a more modern and consistent editing experience. For anyone using multiple Atlassian products, we believe this will provide the best editing experience. You can read more about the changes [here|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/jira-cloud-new-issue-view-editor-changes/29993].

 

Regards,
 Nehal Jain
 Jira Product Management
{panel}
h3. Summary

When attempting to create a table in the Comment or Description field in the New Jira Issue View, the table is not rendering correctly.
h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud
 - New Jira Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that you have enabled the New Jira Issue View
 # Go to a board, click on an issue.
 # In the Comment or Description field, attempt to create a table.
 -- 
||header||
|text|

 # This also affects tags which are using the curly brackets.
 -- 
{code:java}
 Text \{code}
 -- {noformat} Text \{noformat}
 -- {quote} Text \{quote}

h3. Expected Results
 - In the field, you will see this table:
||header||
|text|

 - The text in between the Wiki Markup tags will also be formatted.

h3. Actual Results
 - The table will not rendered. Instead, you will see the literal characters without any formatting.
 - The text in between the Wiki Markup tags will not be formatted.

h3. Notes
 - After attempting to create a table through the New Jira Issue View, editing the Comment or Description field from the Old Issue View, we can see that the Vertical Bar character (pipe symbol) is escaped.
{code:java}
\|\|header\|\|
\|text\|
{code}

 - Similarly, all curly brackets will automatically be escaped.

h3. Workaround
 # Disable the New Jira Issue View.
 -- This can be done by Clicking on the Profile Icon at the bottom left -> *Personal Settings* (or *Profile*). Under the "Labs" section, disable the "New Jira Issue View".
fields.summary: Wiki Markup does not work in the New Jira Issue View
Improve issue property 404 response (it's too general) or provide a different HTTP response code

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there is a limitation that only 5 properties can be requested (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-search-get - It is also not allowed to request all properties. The number of different properties that may be requested in one query is limited to 5).
To reduce network request count is it possible to remove this restriction and request all issue properties? Or at least request properties by name, but not limited to only 5?
fields.summary: Return all issue properties in search API

fields.description:
In Jira, is possible to remove attached files, if the user has the rights. However, allow the users to remove files breaks the company integrity, i.e. if anything goes wrong because of an attached file, the user can remove the file and scape from the responsibility. So, our users are not allowed to remove attached files.

The problem is when a file is not necessary, e.g. an update of the file is attached to the issue. It is important to keep both files because of history (and integrity), but show both on the bug may cause confusion. It will be great if we could archive the attachments, i.e. hide the files from the first view, but show them if it is necessary (button: show archived).
fields.summary: Archive attachments

fields.description:
It would be nice to view where user groups are being used under User Management > Groups > [Group Name] 
See attached drafted image  !Screen Shot 2018-04-09 at 15.07.36 PM.png|thumbnail!

Clicking "View", admins could see Projects and Filters where the group is being used.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-09 at 15.12.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It would be useful as an admin to be able to easily track where user groups are being utilized.
fields.summary: View where User Groups are being used

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, built-in log work feature in Jira does not support custom fields in the log work screen. In this case, if the customer wants this functionality, it's necessary to find a third-party add-on.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to set up custom fields in the log work screen. And additionally, enable a one-to-many relationship between the logged work, and the custom fields, where it's possible to set up multiple values on each worklog.

h3. Why this is important
Some customers want to use the log work field in more complex ways, so this would be a valuable addition.
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Provide a way to set up multiple customized values in the log work screen

fields.description:

h3. *Summary*

When viewing the custom fields' list, it is possible to see which issue types are associated to a field's context:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-09 at 1.55.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 
Once you click go in to configure the field, the issue types are not displayed under it's context:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-09 at 1.57.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It displays when the context is applicable for all issue types (global).

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Jira home -> *Settings* -> *Issues* -> *Custom fields*;
 # Search for any field where it's context is set to specific issue types. You will be able to see the issue types applicable for it's context;
 # Click on the elipses button right to it -> *Configure*. The *Issue types* field is empty.

h3. Expected Results
The issue types should be displayed as a preview, just like on the first screen.

h3. Actual Results
The issue types are not displayed. Giving the impression that there are no issue types associated to it.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, only admins can change the default outgoing mail format (either "plain text" or "HTML") and this setting is done globally for "regular", non-admin users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Users should have the ability to change the outgoing mail format individually by accessing their profile.

h3. Why this is important
To enhance the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
There is none.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to change the format of my email notifications (plain text or HTML)

fields.description: I, as Jira Admin, would like to be able to disable the Feedback button.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to Disable Feedback Button

fields.description:
In the following document, the maximum attachment size is described as the following.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-file-attachments-802593126.html
bq. The default is 10485760 bytes (10 MB). The maximum attachment size is 2147483647 bytes (2 GB).

With this description, the reader can't decide the limitation is about *per issue* or *per file*.
It would be great if the document clearly specifies that this maximum size will be a limit *per file*, not per issue.
fields.summary: Clearly specify the definition of the maximum attachment size

fields.description:
When attempting to attach a file to a JIRA issue, if the filename contains characters that Jira doesn't like, then the attachment is totally rejected:

!Screenshot from 2018-02-12 12-02-11.png!

This is quite frustrating because the rules for allowed characters in filenames differ by OS, and there are several programs on Linux that naturally generate filenames containing {{:}}, which JIRA doesn't like.

[Every web framework and its mom has a function to sanitize filenames in a cross-platform-safe way these days|http://werkzeug.pocoo.org/docs/0.14/utils/#werkzeug.utils.secure_filename], so it seems like this should be a pretty easy fix.
fields.summary: JIRA should sanitize attachment filename rather than reject them outright

fields.description:
When doing a bulk change, I don't have an option to link all the issues to some issue

Note: I see only "Change Epic Link" option as part of the "Edit Issues"
|Edit Issues|Edit field values of issues|

Workaround to bulk linking issues:
 Workaround
 Create an automation rule:
 1. Trigger:
 Chose any type of trigger depending on your use case. If you only want to do it once, you may want to choose Scheduled trigger then run the rule manually.
 2. Add Component > New Branch > Branch rule/related issues > Type of related issues > JQL:
 Specify the JQL query returning the issues you need to edit.
 Ensure there are no order by clauses and the issue you'll need to link to is not included in the query.
 To include a list of issues, the JQL can be:
 key in (key-1, key-2, key-3 etc)
 3. Add Component > Action > Link Issues:
 4. Publish and Run Rule.
 5. Delete the rule if the issues were linked successfully.

!screenshot-1.png|width=261,height=422!
fields.summary: Missing ability to link issues by bulk change

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the *Edit Issue* permission is set to *Current assignee* and/or *Reporter*, when changing the Epic Link of an Issue, an event is fired in the Activity Log but the value doesn't actually change (changes not saved).

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

#Set the *Edit Issue* permission to * Current assignee* and change the Epic link of an issue
h3. Expected Results

Epic link changed to a new value
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is changed and the event is logged as if something was changed.

!_SDK-3__Add_work_items_with____Create_Issue__at_the_top_right_of_the_screen____Try_adding_a_new_card_now_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This happens specifically for the Epic link field, other fields are not affected.
h3. Workaround

There is no exact workaround, simply grant the permission to the group/user/role that needs to do the change.
fields.summary: Epic link not changing

h3. Summary

When using parallel sprints option.
Sprint field for issues on a sprint that is not the active sprint (such as future sprints) is being displayed as empty in the new issue view. The field is correctly filled when accessing the ticket itself
h3. Environment
 * Parallel sprints option enabled
 * Issues allocated to a future sprint

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the Parallel sprints option
 # Create two sprints (one being the active sprint)
 # Allocate one issue to each sprint

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
 * The issue in the active sprint has its "Sprint" field correctly filled but The issue in the sprint that is not active has "Sprint" field empty in the new issue. (screenshot-1)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The new issue detail view does not display when the Chrome extension Redux DevTools is open

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Redux DevTools extension in Chrome
# Preview story in the Kanban board
# Error is thrown and story never loads

h3. Expected Results
You can see the issue details

h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown and issue detail view never loads
 
h3. Notes

This is probably because some portion of Redux state is unserializable (extension serializes state to send to worker).

h3.Workaround
* Close Redux DevTools when using Kanban board
* Disable the new issue detail view following the steps described below:
# Click on your avatar and click *Profile*
# Under *Labs*, uncheck the option *New Jira issue view*
fields.summary: The new issue detail view does not display when the Chrome extension Redux DevTools is open

The issue key is show as a link (at least when viewing on old editor)

h3. Actual Results
It's not showing as a link on new and old editor. Weird characters are added after the project key. Eg:
{quote}
PBâ-51
{quote}


h3. Notes
* Couldn't 'see' the difference from interface
* Way to find the differences:
*# iconv
{code}
~ $ iconv -f utf-8 -t utf-16 notworking
��PB
           -33
~ $ iconv -f utf-8 -t utf-16 working
��PB-33
{code}
*# diff
{code}
$ diff working notworking 
1c1
< PB-33
---
> PB-33
{code}

Disable the new issue detail view under your profile.

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 Dec 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. this feature *Restricted comments* is now available for all users on classic projects in Jira cloud.

Thanks for your patience and we advise you to use the new issue view again if you previously opted out because of missing this feature. You can do so via your *Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on. 

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}


{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 Dec 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. We have started rolling out this feature *Restricted comments* this week and hopefully, it will be available for all classic project customers in the next couple of weeks.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 10 Dec 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. We are planning to start the rollout of this feature *Restricted comments* this month and hopefully, it will be available for all classic project customers early Jan and it will include all the existing functionality that was on the old issue view. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}


{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25 Nov 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. We have started the work on this feature, *Restricted comments*, and aiming to roll it out in the next couple of months and it will include all the existing functionality that was on the old issue view. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}





{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 30 Nov 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. We have been building and rolling out the new issue view for some time now, and there are still some key pieces of missing functionality that we are eager to build but have not gotten to yet, Restricted comments being one of them. 

We are currently working on several other features and improvements for the new view. A few examples that are a higher priority now are adding back the ability to manager watchers and the ability to order your custom order fields.

We have planned to start work on this feature, *Restricted comments*, in the next few months and it will include all the existing functionality that was on the old issue view. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
h3.  
h3. Summary

On the new issue detail view, the option to restrict comments is missing on the comment field on the issue. 

 
h3. Environment (Optional - If Applicable)

Instances having the " New Issue detail view" option enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a board 
 # Select an issue from the board to open the issue detailed view pop-up
 # Click on the comment field

h3. Expected Results

The padlock icon should appear on the comment field to allow comment restriction.
h3. Actual Results 

The padlock icon is missing.  !image-2018-01-12-17-42-23-766.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This also effects any Jira Service Desk issues. It prevents the "Internal Comment" button from showing up if a Jira Service Desk Issue is viewed in this way via a board.
h3. Workaround
 

You can disable the new issue view by either:
 * Click on your avatar (bottom  left section of the screen), Select *Personal Settings* and switch of the switch under "Atlassian Labs"
 * Add *?oldIssueView=true* to the url of the issues you want to see using the old UI

However, as mentioned in the personal settings page, please note that:
{quote}The new issue view is on for all [business|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/See+what%27s+possible+with+Jira+Core] boards and [next-gen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-next-gen-software-projects-945104895.html] projects, so this won't affect them.
{quote}
fields.summary: Comment restriction is missing from the new issue detail view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you comment a issue key (e.g. FP-5), it will create a link to that issue in the comments, even showing the current status.

But it is not working properly in the new detail view:
* If the issue mentioned has no resolution set, it will display a link without the current status;
* And if the issue mentioned has a resolution set, it won't appear at all.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Comment an issue key (an issue with no resolution set) in an issue that is in an active sprint;
 # Comment another issue key (this one with a resolution set) in the same issue;
 # Go to the board where the issue you added the comments to is being displayed, and click on it to open the detail view.

PS. You need to have the Labs feature active:
* Click on the profile icon -> *Profile* -> search for and activate the *Labs* feature.

h3. Expected Results
The issues mentioned should be displayed as a link to themselves, including the current status they are at:
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-30 at 10.06.19 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The mentioned issues are not displayed correctly, or not displayed at all:
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-30 at 10.08.43 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The same behaviour is observed in the description field too. Disabling the labs feature allows the mentioned issue number to be displayed.

h3. Workaround

The issues' links are displayed correctly in the old detail view, so turning off the Labs feature is an option.

*Update:* You can also use the link button feature to directly link an issue in the comments:  [^Issue key link in comments.mp4]
fields.summary: The issue link is not working properly in the new detail view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The new Jira issue view is ignoring the "Condition to hide a transition from the user. The transition can only be triggered from a workflow function or from REST." condition of the workflow.

*UPDATE!* Confirmed this is happening with probably any condition.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the mentioned condition to a transition on your workflow;
# Be sure you have the "new Jira issue view" enabled on your Lab section of your profile;
# Access a board where there is an issue that uses the relevant workflow;
# Click on one issue, then click the *status* dropdown menu;

h3. Expected Results
* The transition with the mentioned condition *is not* visible in the list.

h3. Actual Results
* The transition with the mentioned condition *is* visible in the list.

 !merge transition.png|thumbnail! 

 !merge transition condition.png|thumbnail! 

 !Merge transition .png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* Disable the new Jira issue view on the Lab section of your profile, as this transition is not visible when viewing the issue.
fields.summary: Hidden transitions are shown on new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Issue quick view in board is taking a long time to load.

# Navigate to a board
# Click on the issue to view

The popup loads quickly.

h2. Current Result

Please note that the workaround above only applies per user based.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have configured a validator in a workflow transition (that requires the comment field filled) and associate a screen (with a text field) to it, you won't be able to type in the field when the screen pops-up during the transition if you perform it by directly changing the status in the new issue details view.
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Creating the environment (the same as the one that affected the customer):

 # Create a screen with only the *Comment* field on it (create the screen and remove every field from it's configuration);
 # Create a *Field is required* validator in a transition and associate the screen previously created with it;

 * Executing:
 ** If you try the transition by directly changing the status in the issue detail view (Labs active), it won't let you type in the comment field:
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-24 at 5.20.29 PM.png!
               !Screen Shot 2018-01-24 at 12.28.28.png!
 ** If you drag and drop the card in the board, it works correctly;
 ** If you go to the issue view page and try performing the transition from there, it works too.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to type in the field and perform the transition.
h3. Actual Results

You are not able to type in the field.

The following triggers when trying the transition (browser inspect):

!error AJAX.png!

This one is showing up before performing the action (click on the console error link):  *{"errorMessages":["key not found: 'hasInteractedWithFeedbackButton'"],"errors":{}}*
h3. Workaround

Using the card drag and drop, and going directly to the issue page will work correctly.
h3. Update
 - Turns out that it can affect any text field, and it does not really have to be the only field in the screen. But it won't be possible to type in it during the transition even if there is no validator in the workflow related to that same field.
 - Fields are greyed out and unable to edit/change the value
 - !image-2018-02-15-16-11-44-745.png!
fields.summary: Can't type in fields when transitioning

h3. Summary
The new board's issue detail view does not appear in the Microsoft Edge.

h3. Environment
* Edge - issue reported in Edge, still confirming the issue can be replicated in this browser. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA and select {{Boards}}>>{{View all boards}} (make sure the new issue detail view is enabled in Jira checking the "Profile" option).
# Select any board.
# Go to *Backlog* and select an issue.
# Go to *Active sprint* (or Kanban board) and select an issue.

h3. Expected Results
* The issue detail view appears at the right of the screen in the backlog showing the issue's details
* A popup window appears showing the issue's details in Active sprint and Kanban board

h3. Actual Results
* The blank panel appears at the right of the screen in the backlog
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-26 at 15.50.39.png|thumbnail! 
* Nothing happens in Active sprint and Kanban board
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-26 at 15.52.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Disable the Labs feature. This can be done by going to your user profile, clicking on your avatar in the top right of the screen and selecting Profile, then flipping the switch for this Jira labs feature.
 !print.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira Labs new Issue detail view popup feature does not work in Microsoft Edge

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 30th April 2021}
Hi everyone,

This issue has been resolved. If you are still seeing issues with a bug that is similar to this one we are tracking it here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76532

Regards,
Atlassian

 
{panel}
h3.  

Problem Description

Unable to create subtasks on the new JIRA issue view if there is a required field.
 Error "Wait a few moments, than give it another try."
 - !16511.png|thumbnail!  

Also, the button to quick add sub-task is not shown.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Ensure you are 'Experiencing the new Jira' aka ADG3
 # Set up your project to the have *Assignee* field as required while creating a new Subtask OR the *Summary* field *not* *included* in the *Create/Edit Issue* screen of the subtask
 # Access a board.
 # Create a new Story.
 # Select the Story on your board.
 # Try to create a new sub-task via the new Jira issue view 

h3. Expected Result

A pop up to enter the issue's required fields should appear.

Actual Result

Error "Wait a few moments, than give it another try" is shown or the option to create sub-task is not available.
h3. Workaround
 # Remove the required field
 or
 # Open the issue in JIRA, outside the board view, there you will be able to create a new Subtask.

OR

Include the *Summary* field in the *Create/Edit Issue* screen of the subtask

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description:
 
There are times that Epic, Epic children (Story, Bug etc) and Subtask have different Versions. As users, we have a significant issue management problem where Epics and their associated issues (Stories, Tasks, bugs) have their fixVersion mis-matched. Also, similarly for the case when issues (Stories, Tasks, bugs) and their sub-tasks have a mis-match in fixVersion.

We want to be able to quickly find and correct these mis-matches, either completely automatically, or through some quick filters and subsequent bulk change

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide tools (or report) or JQL to find these mismatched Fix Versions.
fields.summary: Provide JQL to find all the mismatched version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the amount of gadgets in a dashboard is limited to 20, and it's not possible to increase this limit. If try to add more than 20 gadgets in a single dashboard following message appears:
{code}
Sorry, you have exceeded the maximum number of gadgets supported by your Dashboard. You must remove some gadgets before proceeding
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to increase the maximum number of gadgets in the dashboard
fields.summary: Ability to increase the maximum number of gadgets in dashboard

fields.description:
*Problem*

Jira has no warning regarding some data loss possibilities

 

*Suggestion*

There should be some notification when there were no backups made in some period of time (e.g. in the last couple of weeks) or if the *Delete Issues* permission is being granted to more that X users on any given project.
fields.summary: Jira should have some warning regarding possible data loss

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As Jira and Confluence are using the same editor with markdown support they have the same functionality and limitations.
Right now, if you hit Enter it will trigger a hard return (it start a new paragraph) instead of a soft return (line break).

Therefore, if you want to continue the text on the line below, it's necessary to use Shift+Enter.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to configure which action the commands Enter and Shift+Enter will trigger in terms of return.

h3. Why this is important
Some customers may be confused with the change as they are used to hit Enter twice to start a new paragraph and hitting Enter once creates a soft return.
 
h3. Workaround 
Disable the new Jira issue view, as the text editor is bundled into it.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to configure the hard and soft returns in the Jira/Confluence editor

fields.description:
Documentation: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-field-fieldKey-option-post

*Create issue field option*

According to the documentation, you can create an issue field option with the API: {code}POST /rest/api/2/field/{fieldKey}/option{code}

However, this API is exclusive for custom fields created by add-ons, it does not work for custom fields created in JIRA.

There's a comment by Dave Meyer (who was the product manager involved in creating that feature) [here|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/picking-the-right-fieldkey-in-rest-api-2-field-fieldkey-option/12296/7]. He said:
{quote}
There is no public API for managing the options of a regular custom field, only for Issue Fields defined by apps that have been installed in the site. Apologies for the confusion.
{quote}

Please update the documentation to make it clear that this API only works for add-ons.

Here is the feature request to implement this API in JIRA.
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36112
fields.summary: Update documentation Jira Cloud REST API - Atlassian Developers.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to log work / log time in the New Jira Issue View, the "Log Time" pop-up window freezes and the loading circle goes on forever. The Time Spent will not be saved.
h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud
 - New Jira Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that you have enabled New Jira Issue View (in your profile).
 # Go to a board (it can be either Scrum, Kanban or Business).
 # Click on an issue, Select the ". . ." -> *Log Time*.
 # Input any Time spent. Then, click on "Log time".

h3. Expected Results

The Time Spent value will be saved, and the pop-up window will be closed.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, and the Time Spent will not be saved. The pop-up window will continue to show the loading circle keep spinning, but the whole page will be unresponsive.
 !unabletologwork..PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Taking a look at the Browser Console, we can see this error:
{code:java}
Uncaught Error: Unexpected UpdateBehavior: undefined
    at async-issue-view.feec1f597c27c558bf29.7.js:1
    at Object.D [as saveField] (async-issue-view.feec1f597c27c558bf29.7.js:1)
    at h (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-rapid-board-issue.b8b15bf2f1f91f30f9ec.7.js:1)
    at j (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-rapid-board-issue.b8b15bf2f1f91f30f9ec.7.js:1)
    at t.project (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-rapid-board-issue.b8b15bf2f1f91f30f9ec.7.js:1)
    at t._next (vendor.0c6b279e666037071122.7.js:1)
    at t.next (vendor.0c6b279e666037071122.7.js:1)
    at t.next (vendor.0c6b279e666037071122.7.js:1)
    at t._group (vendor.0c6b279e666037071122.7.js:1)
    at t._next (vendor.0c6b279e666037071122.7.js:1)
{code}
h3. Workaround
 # Log work outside of the board (directly on the View Issue screen), or
 # Disable the New Jira Issue View.
 -- This can be done by Clicking on the Profile Icon at the bottom left -> Profile. Under the "Labs" section, disable the "New Jira Issue View".
fields.summary: Unable to log work in the New Jira Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Jira search export current fields does not follow the visible field configuration chosen by the user. Only the following mapping works for the current fields export.

|Saved Filter|*Filter* Configuration|
|New Filter (Unsaved)|*My Defaults* Configuration|
|Modified Saved Filter (Unsaved)|*My Defaults* Configuration|


h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1* : Modified Saved Filter
# Create an issue filter and save it. Run the export ("Export Excel CSV current fields") and notice that the order of the columns is the same in the CSV as in the Web UI
# Change the filter (i.e. add or remove one of the statuses)  and re-run the same export. Notice that the Web UI columns are in the order mentioned in the filter while the exported CSV file columns are in another order ("My default" columns order).
This creates a difference between the Web UI and the CSV columns order

*Scenario 2* : Choose any column configuration

 !column config.png|thumbnail! 

- Open any saved filter
- Choose the *My Defaults* column configuration
- Export current fields (CSV). 




h3. Expected Results
The columns should be in the same order in the Web UI as in the export file.

h3. Actual Results

Only the following mapping will work :

|Saved Filter|*Filter* Configuration|
|New Filter (Unsaved)|*My Defaults* Configuration|
|Modified Saved Filter (Unsaved)|*My Defaults* Configuration|


h3. Notes

This affects the export current fields and Print list. 

h3. Update

This problem may affect filter subscriptions as well.
fields.summary: Export current fields does not follow the visible column configuration

Suggested Solution

h3. Description

Board's filter has two different projects, each project has its own permission scheme. The board is nested in project-1 and requires "Manage Sprints" in both projects, instead of Just project-1, in order to start/close sprints.
h3. Actual Results

Users must have "Manage Sprint" in both projects in order to start/close a sprint in project-1
h3. Expected Results

Users should only have "Manage Sprint" in project-1 in order to start/close a sprint in the same project (even though it has issues from another project).
fields.summary: Manage Sprint permission for two projects with individual permission schemes

fields.description: Jira sends way, way too many e-mails by default and still does when with a proper notfication scheme set up. So much so that after just a few days working with it, I'm on the verge of redirecting everything from Jira to a spam box. I personally need to be kept up-to-date when an issue is updated in certain ways, but not every time someone changes a comma. I'd like to be able specify per form field if an update in that field will cause an e-mail to be sent to me and I'd also like to be able to select which status changes cause an e-mail to be sent to me. For instance, only when a comment is added and when a status is set to Ready for QA or Resolved I'd like to be notified, but not with every other update of the issue. This profile specific notification scheme should be a refinement (more limiting) of the general notification scheme.
fields.summary: Add user profile specifc ability to select which issue updates generate e-mail notification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently loading an issue or project's page sends requests to the installed add-ons, even if the add-ons is not meant to be used for this project. This results into latency in page loads, specially when there are several add-ons being installed.

h3. Suggested Solution
An admin should be able to manage add-on's context and limit the add-on to specific projects.

h3. Why this is important
This could reduce the unnecessarily requests/calls to add-ons for those issues/projects where the add-ons are not being used, which could provide a better page load.
fields.summary: Ability to add context for add-ons

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the POST to /rest/api/2/user endpoint to create users that have been deleted from the UI, you will get an error like this instead:
{noformat}
'{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"username":"A user with that username already exists."}}'
{noformat}


h3. Environment
Cloud With JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a new user using the rest API endpoint and a payload like this:
{noformat}
{"displayName": "testuser", "emailAddress": "example@email.com", "name": "testuser"}
{noformat}
Note that the user will be created.
- Go to /admin/users and delete the newly created user.
- Re-run the REST call to create the user with the same payload as before.


h3. Expected Results
The User is recreated exactly as specified.

h3. Actual Results
You get a 400 response code and this error:
{noformat}
'{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"username":"A user with that username already exists."}}'
{noformat}

No user is created.

h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround.
fields.summary: POST /rest/api/2/user cannot create user with same username as a deleted user.

fields.summary: Allow cross-domain requests to REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After an email is sent to an inbox (or a folder) read by an incoming email handler in Jira Cloud, in some situations, this email may have a Message-ID longer than 255 characters. In this case, Jira will create a ticket for it but fail when adding a reference to this issue in table 'notification instance'. 

Since it fails, it won't archive the message or mark it as read, processing it again, having the same length issue and creating multiple issues until the message is finally removed from the inbox manually. This may cause multiple issues for the same email to be processed over and over again.

The Message-ID should be limited by the line limit defined in [RFC-2822|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt] of 998 characters (way more than 255), so this is a limit to consider.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a mailbox and an incoming handler reading for it
# Send a message with Message-ID longer than 255 characters

h3. Expected Results
Email is processed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Issue or comment is created, but it fails to add an entry to 'notificationinstance', processing the email several times. This error appears:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:NotificationInstance][messageid,<long Message ID here>][source,99999999][type,ISSUE_CREATED_FROM_EMAIL][email,email@domain.com] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.notificationinstance (notificationtype, SOURCE, emailaddress, MESSAGEID) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)))
 at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:312)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailThreadManagerImpl.storeIncomingMessageId(MailThreadManagerImpl.java:50)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.recordIncomingMessageId(AbstractMessageHandler.java:1524)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateIssueHandler.addCcWatchersAndAttachments(CreateIssueHandler.java:265)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateIssueHandler.handleAcceptedMessage(CreateIssueHandler.java:248)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.handleMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:401)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleAcceptedMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:109)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.handleMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:401)
 at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.SingleMessageProcessorImpl.process(SingleMessageProcessorImpl.java:46)
...
 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748) 
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:NotificationInstance][messageid,<long Message ID here>][source,99999999][type,ISSUE_CREATED_FROM_EMAIL][email,email@domain.com] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.notificationinstance (notificationtype, SOURCE, emailaddress, MESSAGEID) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)))
 at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:219)
{code}


h3.Workaround
If the issue was already processed, remove it from inbox or any folder that is read by the handler.
fields.summary: Message IDs longer than 255 characters can cause email loop and multiple issues created from the same incoming email

fields.description:
It would be nice to prevent Jira from matching emails to existing tickets using the In-Reply-To field of the email header, and only match them if the subject line contains the issue key.

One scenario would be:
Is that some users receive emails that have also gone to a wrong support email address and generated a ticket, but are not aware of this and are forwarding the email to the proper support email with questions. These emails are being added as public comments to the original ticket, and a notification sent to the reporter of the original. The contents of these are *not* meant to be externally visible, and this could potentially cause huge problems.
fields.summary: Prevent JIRA Service Desk from Matching emails to existing ticket using the In-Reply-To Field
